name: Medical Technology
description: Medical laboratory technology, diagnostic imaging, and biomedical equipment

questions.question_text: Describe the quality control procedures you follow in a clinical laboratory.
questions.expected_answer: Daily QC, Levey-Jennings charts, Westgard rules, proficiency testing

questions.question_text: How do you handle critical lab values and what is the reporting protocol?
questions.expected_answer: Immediate notification, verification, documentation, read-back

questions.question_text: Explain the principles behind PCR testing.
questions.expected_answer: DNA amplification, denaturation, annealing, extension, clinical applications

questions.question_text: How do you troubleshoot an automated analyzer that produces unexpected results?
questions.expected_answer: Systematic approach: controls, calibration, reagents, maintenance logs

questions.question_text: Describe your experience with blood banking and transfusion medicine.
questions.expected_answer: ABO/Rh typing, crossmatching, antibody screening, compatibility testing

questions.question_text: What safety protocols do you follow when handling biological specimens?
questions.expected_answer: Universal precautions, PPE, biosafety levels, waste disposal

questions.question_text: How do you ensure accuracy of patient specimen identification?
questions.expected_answer: Two-identifier verification, barcoding, chain of custody

questions.question_text: Tell me about a time you identified an error in laboratory results.
questions.expected_answer: Detection, investigation, correction, preventive measures

questions.question_text: Explain the difference between sensitivity and specificity in diagnostic testing.
questions.expected_answer: True positives/negatives, clinical significance, test selection

questions.question_text: How do you maintain competency in rapidly evolving medical technology?
questions.expected_answer: Continuing education, certifications, vendor training, conferences

questions.question_text: Describe the regulatory requirements for clinical laboratories.
questions.expected_answer: CLIA, CAP accreditation, state regulations, documentation requirements

questions.question_text: How would you handle a specimen that does not meet acceptance criteria?
questions.expected_answer: Rejection criteria, communication with collector, documentation, recollection

questions.question_text: Explain the principle of flow cytometry and its clinical applications.
questions.expected_answer: Cell sorting, fluorescence, immunophenotyping, leukemia/lymphoma diagnosis

questions.question_text: What is your experience with point-of-care testing?
questions.expected_answer: POCT devices, correlation with lab results, QC, operator training

questions.question_text: How do you approach method validation for a new laboratory test?
questions.expected_answer: Accuracy, precision, linearity, reference range, comparison studies

questions.question_text: Describe the importance of pre-analytical variables in laboratory testing.
questions.expected_answer: Patient preparation, collection, transport, processing effects on results

questions.question_text: How do you prioritize work when the laboratory is experiencing high volume?
questions.expected_answer: STAT orders first, systematic batching, communication, time management

questions.question_text: What measures do you take to prevent laboratory-acquired infections?
questions.expected_answer: Standard precautions, BSC use, decontamination, spill procedures

questions.question_text: Explain your understanding of hemoglobin electrophoresis.
questions.expected_answer: Hemoglobin variants, sickle cell, thalassemia, interpretation patterns

questions.question_text: How do you handle equipment calibration and preventive maintenance?
questions.expected_answer: Calibration schedules, documentation, vendor PM, performance verification

questions.question_text: Describe a time when you had to work under pressure to deliver critical results.
questions.expected_answer: Time management, accuracy under pressure, communication, outcome

questions.question_text: What role does laboratory informatics play in modern healthcare?
questions.expected_answer: LIS, data management, interfacing, reporting, decision support

questions.question_text: How do you perform and interpret a Gram stain?
questions.expected_answer: Staining procedure, morphology identification, clinical significance

questions.question_text: What is your experience with molecular diagnostics?
questions.expected_answer: PCR, sequencing, gene expression, infectious disease panels

questions.question_text: How do you communicate laboratory results effectively to clinical staff?
questions.expected_answer: Clear reporting, flagging abnormals, consultation, interpretation aids
